pageContext.description:
A complete Late Bronze Age cast copper-alloy tanged chisel (1150 BC-800 BC).
 
It is triangular in form and rectangular in cross-section. The tang flares out for a distance of about 32.0mm and then flares more widely to the cutting edge. The cutting edge is evenly rounded in plan and is steeply 'V'-shaped in side view. Each side of the tang has an uneven surface.
 
The surfaces have a mid-brown patina with some bubbly corrosion products. There is a small area of iron staining on one face close to the cutting edge.
 
52.2 x 40.0 x 4.6mm. Weight: 20.29g.
 
The implement probably belongs to the earlier period of the Late Bronze Age (pers. comm., Peter Reavill, 16/02/2011.
